reference.shortdesc: A navigation title is an alternate title for a resource; this alternate title is optimized for situations where the topic title is unsuitable for use in a table of contents or navigation pane.

section.title: Usage information
section.p: Navigation titles can be used in both topics and maps. When used in maps, a navigation title can serve as an alternate title or simply as an aid to understanding the DITA map.

Because the navtitle element is available within topicmeta, a navtitle element might occur in contexts where a navigation title does not make sense, for example, on a topicgroup element. In those situations, the navtitle element has no defined purpose.

section.title: Processing expectations
section.p: When the navtitle element is used in a topic, processors SHOULD use the contents of the element to generate the navigation title.

When the navtitle element is used in a map, processors SHOULD retrieve the navigation title in the following order:
From the content of a navtitle element in the map, if the containing topicref element sets the value of the locktitle attribute to "yes"
From the contents of a navtitle element in the referenced topic
From the title of the referenced topic
